comments.body: What does the `rollbackStates` field represent? Is it a stack of rollback states? Might be worth documenting above.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +56,60 @@  private case class AddTransactionState(
      currentState: RollbackState,
      rollbackStates: List[RollbackState],
      errs: Set[RejectionReason],
      parties: Set[Party],

comments.body:
Prefer vanilla matching with `Nil` and `::` to avoid disabling exhaustive pattern match checking.
```
              case Nil => sys.error("IMPOSSIBLE: Rollback end but rollback stack is empty")
              case head :: tail => (head,tail)
```
Currently the `Seq()` case can be removed and the compiler won't complain. Scala, eh? :man_shrugging:

Note unrelated to this PR: this class is used in two places: 
- In-memory sandbox classic. In this case, there is only a single participant and we have full trust in the daml interpretation during command execution.
- In a very old migration of the index database. In this case, we *could* encounter transactions submitted through different participants. This use prevents us from simplifying or removing this class, and we should at some point try to get rid of this migration.
Iâ€™ve added a comment where this is used at the top of the class 51f73798e726066f8eb07c3934a0f3ea0c9b5af6
